column6: Job/Team Function
column19: Notes

column6: Lead CQC's Board in developing a vision for effective regulation of health and adult social care; hold Executive to account for delivery; represent CQC nationally, with ministers and stakeholders.
column19: Part time post - 22.5 hours per week. Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

column6: To lead CQC, to deliver the vision and objectives set by the Board; driving the delivery of effective regulation in order to improve the quality of health and social care and to protect the rights of those detained under the Mental Health Act.
To lead the inspection and regulation of primary care services across the public, private and independent sectors.
column19: Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

column6: To assess and judge how well hospitals put the quality of care and the interests of patients at the heart of everything that they do; provide the public with assurance that services are safe, effective, caring, well led and responsive to people’s needs; oversee a national team of expert hospital inspectors that will carry out targeted inspections in response to quality concerns and regional teams of inspectors who will undertake routine inspections on a regular basis of all hospitals; lead the development of a ratings system for NHS acute hospitals and mental health trusts.
column19: Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

column6: Strategic leadership and management of regulation of health, mental health and social care within one of the four Regional Sectors.
column19: Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

To lead and shape the CQC's change programme.
column19: Interim member of staff

column6: To lead and deliver a communications strategy to support CQC’s work across the delivery cycle from design through to publications.
To design and implement HR processes and people development policies to support delivery of CQC’s regulatory activity .
column19: Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

column6: To deliver intelligence to trigger and inform regulatory activity and publish information in line with the regulatory model.
To drive regulatory change across CQC through the design, development and innovation of CQC’s regulatory strategy, model and processes.

To lead on the development of a coherent, credible and nationally recognised strategy for the Care Quality Commission; to lead CQC’s professional strategy, policy, planning, performance and communication teams ensuring that the CQC strategy is delivered.
To undertake a wide range of analyses and surveys to support CQC’s regulatory activity. This includes our reviews and studies programme.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To ensure that CQC is a modern and effective regulator by analysing external policy developments and applying this to CQC's work, applying better regulation principles and evaluating CQC's regulatory model.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To lead on financial strategy and management of CQC's financial resources.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To deliver effective and efficient support to the Board, Commissioners, Chair and Chief Executive though the private office and secretariat.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To lead delivery of all aspects of Reward, HR Business Partnering and HR Services to support the employee lifecycle and facilitate delivery of CQC’s regulatory model.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: Responsible for the delivery of ICT Services and the maintenance of the organisation's IS and ICT Infrastructure.

column6: Manages a team of IT professionals who are responsible for developing and supporting the CQC’s business systems portfolio and ensuring appropriate strategies and processes are in place in order to meet the CQC’s needs for fit for purpose business systems solutions.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To make the information and intelligence needed by staff across CQC to do their jobs easily captured, accurate and accessible to them.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To establish and maintain an effective in house internal audit function that meets Government Internal Audit Standards, which delivers an agreed programme of risk based audits of CQC activities to provide professional assurance on these activities.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed. Salary costs of reports not disclosed as post has a team of fewer than five people.

column6: To deliver the user voice programme to ensure the views of people who use services flow from the design to the delivery of a regulatory model that protects their rights.
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To establish CQC’s desired culture and environment through people development activities, focusing on motivating and supporting individual and organisational growth. The function includes Learning and Development.

column5: Head of National Customer Services Centre
column6: Responsible for the National Processing Centre and National Contact Centre delivery, CQC's interaction with public and provider queries via telephone, email, fax and mail. To ensure that the Centres can deliver, that they will support the new regulatory model and provide seamless support to field force activity.

column6: To lead and drive continuous improvement and development activity across the whole of Operations to enable effective delivery of the business plan. To lead bespoke operational programmes to pilot new methods and approaches to CQC regulatory activity.

column5: Head of Operational Planning and Performance
column6: Enables delivery of regulation in the regions and via the national teams by monitoring performance, planning for programme delivery, managing resource planning and driving corrective interventions.

column6: The analysis (and interpretation of intelligence and evidence) of the most current information relating to the performance of the providers we regulate. The purpose of this is to provide intelligence to the Operations part of the field force at a local level which supports them in reaching evidence based judgements regarding the most appropriate regulatory action to take in the performance of their role(s).
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1/1A or equivalent are not disclosed.

column6: To lead the development of CQC’s strategic approach to regulatory partnerships and analyse the implications of legislation, government and other policy developments for CQC’s regulatory model to enable CQC to meet its statutory duties and fulfil its strategic priorities.
